Package com.jme3.scene.mesh

Class VirtualIndexBuffer

java.lang.Object
com.jme3.scene.mesh.IndexBuffer
com.jme3.scene.mesh.VirtualIndexBuffer
Direct Known Subclasses:
WrappedIndexBuffer
public class VirtualIndexBuffer extends IndexBuffer
IndexBuffer implementation that generates vertex indices sequentially based on a specific Mesh Mesh.Mode. The generated indices are as if the mesh is in the given mode but contains no index buffer, thus this implementation will return the indices if the index buffer was there and contained sequential triangles. Example:
  • Mesh.Mode.Triangles: 0, 1, 2 | 3, 4, 5 | 6, 7, 8 | ...
  • Mesh.Mode.TriangleStrip: 0, 1, 2 | 2, 1, 3 | 2, 3, 4 | ...
  • Mesh.Mode.TriangleFan: 0, 1, 2 | 0, 2, 3 | 0, 3, 4 | ...

    • put

      public IndexBuffer put(int i, int value)
      Description copied from class: IndexBuffer
      Absolute put method.

      Puts the vertex index at the index buffer's index. Implementations may throw an UnsupportedOperationException if modifying the IndexBuffer is not supported (e.g. virtual index buffers).

    • put

      public IndexBuffer put(int value)
      Description copied from class: IndexBuffer
      Relative put method.

      Puts the vertex index at the current position, then increments the position. Implementations may throw an UnsupportedOperationException if modifying the IndexBuffer is not supported (e.g. virtual index buffers).

    • getFormat

      public VertexBuffer.Format getFormat()
      Description copied from class: IndexBuffer
      Returns the format of the data stored in this buffer.

      This method can be used to set an IndexBuffer to a Mesh:

       mesh.setBuffer(Type.Index, 3, 
     indexBuffer.getFormat(), indexBuffer);
